review: I didn't get Cromecast from Amazon, but I have bought enough here that I don't think they will mind. Download this, "television fanatic dot com" just put it into your search engine, they wont let me copy and paste the exact address. It's one hundered percent free and works on Mac too. Thats what I'm using it on. You can get Live TV including sports and over 100 channels. No ESPN but hey, without your cable password. Because of this, I am cancelling cable TV and using chromecast, netflix, hulu, and television fanatic plus an air antenna. Other than ESPN everything else is on there. No, I have nothing to do with them. Just letting the people know HERE IS THE ALTERNATIVE. Amazon Prime is on this!! Go to Watch Movies Tab, and there it is. After a little more looking from suggestions it TF does have Ad-Ware. It's not virus. You however can bring Prime or any other stream up in your Chrome Browser and go to the top right and click the Chomecast source button to TV network, whatever you named it at installation. I'm leaving TF on since I'm on a Mac I don't have the problems before mentioned and I use Safari to surf not Chrome.

review: Price is great.Playing supported apps is great.Want to see something from the web that isn't associated with an app?  You can mirror what is on your screen.....well, only if you use chrome browser.  Oh, and not if you are trying to do it with an iPad or iPhone. Oh, and if you do it from your desktop and your chrome browser; the sound will be out of sync. ( they really need to fix that)However, we have used it everyday to watch netflix and YouTube. Love sonza.Still waiting for someone to make a device that will mirror anything on my iPad and ancient iPhone.Overall it's my bad for not doing more research on its limitations.
